column1: # The reading for January 1882 is an estimate and has been omitted.
# The reading for February 1888 is an estimate and has been omitted.
# August-September 1888 are grouped into a single aggregate reading of 2.80 on the sheet.
# The gauge seems to have been in two or three locations in Bowes.
# The initial observer (W.J.Bousfield) lived at The Villa (NY990135), but all the British Rainfall readings from 1887 onwards have a generic 'Symons' attribution.
# Annotations on the rainfall sheet put the gauge west and then east of the church by about 100 yards, with a 280 yard move.
# The grid reference given is for the church location, in central Bowes.
